title: Marilyn Monroe's Home Declared Historic Landmark Debarring Demolition
content: The Los Angeles home where Marilyn Monroe died was declared a historic landmark on Wednesday, thwarting plans by its current owners to demolish the property.
summary: The Los Angeles home where Marilyn Monroe died was declared a historic landmark on Wednesday, thwarting plans by its current owners to demolish the property.

title: N Korea Tests Multiple-Warhead Missile Amid Growing Tensions With S Korea
content: North Korea successfully tested its multiple-warhead missile capability, state media said Thursday, as dozens more trash-laden balloons from Pyongyang landed in the South.
summary: North Korea successfully tested its multiple-warhead missile capability, state media said Thursday, as dozens more trash-laden balloons from Pyongyang landed in the South.

title: NBC Brings AI Version Of Legendary Broadcaster To Olympic Coverage
content: US media giant NBC Universal on Wednesday announced that it will use the AI version of a legendary sports broadcaster to narrate personalized daily recaps of Olympic game events.
summary: US media giant NBC Universal on Wednesday announced that it will use the AI version of a legendary sports broadcaster to narrate personalized daily recaps of Olympic game events.

title: Top Candidate For Interpol Chief Accused Of Kidnapping 2 Indian Businessmen
content: Mubita Nawa faces allegations of kidnapping and extortion linked to a £105M court case involving businessmen Vinod and Uddit Sadhu.
summary: Mubita Nawa faces allegations of kidnapping and extortion linked to a £105M court case involving businessmen Vinod and Uddit Sadhu.

title: US Man Executed For Raping, Killing Drug Dealer's Girlfriend In 2001
content: An American man was executed Wednesday in Texas for the 2001 murder of a woman.
summary: An American man was executed Wednesday in Texas for the 2001 murder of a woman.

title: Ahead Of UK Polls, All You Need To Know About British PM Rishi Sunak
content: UK will vote on July 4 in a snap general election called by PM  Rishi Sunak. With his Conservative Party trailing the Labour Party by 21 points in the latest polls, Mr Sunak faces an uphill task to retain his party's 14-year grip on power.
summary: UK will vote on July 4 in a snap general election called by PM  Rishi Sunak. With his Conservative Party trailing the Labour Party by 21 points in the latest polls, Mr Sunak faces an uphill task to retain his party's 14-year grip on power.

title: New Strain Of Mpox Causing Miscarriages, Killing Children, Warn Scientists
content: A new deadlier strain of mpox that transmits more easily between people is killing children and causing miscarriages in the Democratic Republic of Congo and may have already spread to neighbouring countries, researchers have warned.
summary: A new deadlier strain of mpox that transmits more easily between people is killing children and causing miscarriages in the Democratic Republic of Congo and may have already spread to neighbouring countries, researchers have warned.

title: New Zealand Woman Who Sued Ex Boyfriend Over Airport Ride Loses Claim
content: The promise of a ride to the airport is not legally binding, a woman in New Zealand has discovered after seeking compensation from her ex-boyfriend because she missed her flight.
summary: The promise of a ride to the airport is not legally binding, a woman in New Zealand has discovered after seeking compensation from her ex-boyfriend because she missed her flight.

title: Astronaut Sunita Williams' Return To Earth Delayed Again. What NASA Said
content: Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams' scheduled return to Earth has been delayed once again after the spacecraft in which she travelled to space, the Boeing Starliner, faced a series of technical glitches.
summary: Indian-origin astronaut Sunita Williams' scheduled return to Earth has been delayed once again after the spacecraft in which she travelled to space, the Boeing Starliner, faced a series of technical glitches.

title: Free From Prison, Julian Assange Plans To "Rediscover Life", Enjoy Freedom
content: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange is "rediscovering" life as he tastes freedom in Australia after a five-year stretch in a London high-security prison, his wife said Thursday.
summary: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange is "rediscovering" life as he tastes freedom in Australia after a five-year stretch in a London high-security prison, his wife said Thursday.

title: Bolivia President Luis Arce Faces Coup Attempt Amid Political Tensions
content: Bolivian President Luis Arce, a mild-mannered and bespectacled former economy minister, faced down a coup attempt on Wednesday, as the armed forces withdrew after occupying the central square in La Paz and entering the presidential palace.
summary: Bolivian President Luis Arce, a mild-mannered and bespectacled former economy minister, faced down a coup attempt on Wednesday, as the armed forces withdrew after occupying the central square in La Paz and entering the presidential palace.

title: Biden, Trump To Face Off In First Presidential Debate Ahead Of US Polls
content: Joe Biden and Donald Trump square off for a historic US presidential debate Thursday, with the stage set for what could be an inflection point in the 2024 race as millions of voters tune in to the clash of rivals.
summary: Joe Biden and Donald Trump square off for a historic US presidential debate Thursday, with the stage set for what could be an inflection point in the 2024 race as millions of voters tune in to the clash of rivals.

title: Larry The Cat Awaits Sixth Prime Minister As UK Election Nears
content: There has been one figure of stability in the last 14 years of political turmoil in the UK -- Larry the Downing Street cat.
summary: There has been one figure of stability in the last 14 years of political turmoil in the UK -- Larry the Downing Street cat.

title: Climate Change And Thinning Ice Exposes Bodies Of Mountaineers On Everest
content: On Everest's sacred slopes, climate change is thinning snow and ice, increasingly exposing the bodies of hundreds of mountaineers who died chasing their dream to summit the world's highest mountain.
summary: On Everest's sacred slopes, climate change is thinning snow and ice, increasingly exposing the bodies of hundreds of mountaineers who died chasing their dream to summit the world's highest mountain.

title: How An Ex President Helped Traffic Cocaine Worth $10 Billion Into US
content: Juan Orlando Hernandez was convicted in a US federal court on three counts, including cocaine importation and weapons offences.
summary: Juan Orlando Hernandez was convicted in a US federal court on three counts, including cocaine importation and weapons offences.

title: Trump And Biden To Have Their 1st Debate Of 2024 Without Studio Audience
content: There will be no studio audience, depriving candidates of the momentum that comes from ginning up supporters. Microphones will cut out when a candidate's speaking time is over. Thursday night's presidential debate will not be business as usual.
summary: There will be no studio audience, depriving candidates of the momentum that comes from ginning up supporters. Microphones will cut out when a candidate's speaking time is over. Thursday night's presidential debate will not be business as usual.

title: From Chaos To Scandals: Moments From US Presidential Debates Over The Years
content: From Gerald Ford's catastrophic Soviet gaffe to Ronald Reagan's witty remark about his age and Joe Biden asking Donald Trump to "shut up," US presidential debates have been funny, vicious and everything in between.
summary: From Gerald Ford's catastrophic Soviet gaffe to Ronald Reagan's witty remark about his age and Joe Biden asking Donald Trump to "shut up," US presidential debates have been funny, vicious and everything in between.

title: I Was "Fired" After Raising Safety Concerns, Claims Boeing Whistleblower
content: Another whistleblower stepped forward Wednesday alleging he was retaliated against after flagging potentially dangerous manufacturing problems on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner.
summary: Another whistleblower stepped forward Wednesday alleging he was retaliated against after flagging potentially dangerous manufacturing problems on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

title: "Broken" Healthcare A Key Issue For UK Voters Ahead Of Elections
content: The NHS, created after World War II to provide free healthcare to all, is a shadow of its former self, weakened by years of underfunding and the Covid-19 pandemic.
summary: The NHS, created after World War II to provide free healthcare to all, is a shadow of its former self, weakened by years of underfunding and the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Man Suffers Heart Attack After Winning Rs 33 Crore Jackpot In Singapore
content: He was quickly rushed to the hospital where he is still recovering.
summary: He was quickly rushed to the hospital where he is still recovering.
